radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver shows no evidence of focal lesions or textural abnormality. There is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. A three mm calcification in the left lobe of the liver is not evident on the CT scan and of doubtful clinical significance. The gallbladder is nondistended with a thickened and edematous wall measuring 6 mm. Mobile gallstones are present. The common bile duct measures 3 mm. The sonographic ___ sign is negative. The pancreas is unremarkable, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic duct dilatation.
